intro: Mammillaria elegans, commonly known as the Elegant Bunny Ears, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and dense covering of white, woolly spines. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–10 centimeters and produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Due to its attractive appearance and ease of care, it is a popular choice for indoor and outdoor cultivation.
